item.title: ISS 就气候变化和公司治理问题斥责巴菲特的伯克希尔哈撒韦公司
item.description: 一家领先的股东咨询公司周四建议，伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）的股东暂缓对沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的企业集团的五名董事进行改选投票，理由是对气候变化和公司治理的担忧。【原文：A leading shareholder advisory firm recommended on Thursday that Berkshire Hathaway shareholders withhold votes to reelect five directors at Warren Buffett's conglomerate, citing concerns about climate change and governance.】

item.title: 美联储主席博斯蒂克称不会 "疯狂着急 "降息
item.description: 亚特兰大联储主席拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）周四表示，通胀率将比许多人预期的更慢地回到美国央行设定的 2% 的水平，"对我来说，这没什么......我并不急于达到这一目标。我并不急于达到这个目标，"因为经济正在继续创造就业机会，工资也在不断上涨。【原文：Atlanta Federal Reserve President Raphael Bostic on Thursday said inflation is going to return to the U.S. central bank's 2% more slowly than many had expected, and "for me, that's okay ... I'm not in a mad dash hurry to get there," because the economy is continuing to create jobs and wages are rising.】

item.title: 沃尔玛支持的 Ibotta 首次上市即估值 35.5 亿美元，表现强劲
item.description: 数字营销公司 Ibotta 周四在纽约证券交易所开盘时股价大涨 33%，首次上市时估值达到 35.5 亿美元。【原文：Digital marketing firm Ibotta notched a valuation of $3.55 billion in its market debut on Thursday, after shares of the Walmart-backed company jumped 33% at open on the NYSE.】

item.title: IMF 称日元跌幅 "显著"，但反映了汇率差异
item.description: 国际货币基金组织表示，日元近期的跌势虽然 "相当显著"，但主要反映了日本和美国之间的利率差，表明日元走势基本符合经济基本面。【原文：The International Monetary Fund said the yen's recent declines, while "quite significant," largely reflect the interest-rate differential between Japan and the United States, suggesting that its moves were largely in line with economic fundamentals.】

item.title: 独家报道埃利奥特考虑竞购 Citgo，债权人集团关注 Conoco 的出价
item.description: 五位知情人士透露，对冲基金埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）正在权衡通过美国法院下令的拍卖竞购炼油商 Citgo Petroleum 母公司的股份，而以 Centerview Partners 为代表的一组债权人则希望吸引康菲石油公司加入另一项竞购。【原文：Hedge fund Elliott Investment Management is weighing a bid for shares in the parent of oil refiner Citgo Petroleum under a U.S. court-ordered auction, while a group of creditors represented by Centerview Partners aims to lure ConocoPhillips to join another offer, five people close to the matter said.】

item.title: 白宫称美国钢铁交易安全审查正常进行
item.description: 一位白宫官员周四表示，美国外国投资委员会对日本新日铁公司收购美国钢铁公司交易的任何审查都将照常进行。【原文：Any review of the deal by Japan's Nippon Steel for U.S. Steel by the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States will proceed as normal, a White House official said on Thursday.】

item.title: 房地美称抵押贷款利率今年首次突破 7
item.description: 周四的一份报告称，美国抵押贷款利率创下了自 6 月份以来的最大增幅，也是自 12 月份以来首次突破 7% 的门槛，从而阻碍了房屋销售的增长。【原文：U.S. mortgage rates increased by the most since June and also crossed the 7% threshold for the first time since December, muddling home sales growth, a Thursday report said.】

item.title: 大众市场需求强劲，欧莱雅第一季度销售额增长 9.4
item.description: 欧莱雅周四公布，第一季度销售额同比增长 9.4%，超出预期，摆脱了人们对主要美容市场美国增长放缓的担忧。【原文：L'Oreal reported a 9.4% rise in first quarter sales on a like-for-like basis on Thursday, beating expectations and shrugging off concerns about a slowdown in leading beauty market the United States.】

item.title: Meta 发布 Llama 3 人工智能模型的早期版本
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司周四发布了其最新大型语言模型 Llama 3 的早期版本，以及一款可在用户输入提示时实时更新图片的图像生成器，努力追赶生成式人工智能市场的领先者 OpenAI。【原文：Meta Platforms on Thursday released early versions of its latest large language model, Llama 3, and an image generator that updates pictures in real time while users type prompts, as it races to catch up to generative AI market leader OpenAI.】

item.title: 摩根大通起诉俄罗斯 VTB 银行要求解冻资产
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase）周四起诉俄罗斯国有 VTB 银行，要求其停止从一个账户中追回 4.395 亿美元的努力，该账户在俄罗斯入侵乌克兰和 VTB 遭受制裁后被冻结。【原文：JPMorgan Chase sued Russia's state-owned VTB Bank on Thursday to halt its efforts to recover $439.5 million from an account that was blocked after Russia invaded Ukraine and VTB was hit with sanctions.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，微软与 OpenAI 的合作可能面临欧盟反垄断调查
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周四表示，微软对 OpenAI 的 130 亿美元投资可能面临欧盟的反垄断调查，因为监管机构正在为这一举动立案。【原文：Microsoft's $13 billion investment in OpenAI could face an EU antitrust investigation as regulators are building the case for such a move, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.】

item.title: 为了超越竞争对手，英特尔率先组装 ASML 的下一代芯片工具
item.description: 英特尔公司周四表示，它已成为首家装配荷兰技术集团 ASML 的新型 "高 NA EUV "光刻工具的公司，这是该美国计算机芯片制造商超越竞争对手的重要一环。【原文：Intel said on Thursday it had become the first company to assemble one of Dutch tech group ASML's new "High NA EUV" lithography tools, an important part of the U.S. computer chip maker's drive to outshine rivals.】

item.title: 德意志银行指出关注机器人出租车存在风险，特斯拉股价下跌
item.description: 周四，特斯拉股价跌至一年多来的最低点，因为德意志银行对这家电动汽车制造商在利润承压的情况下越来越专注于自动驾驶汽车产品表示担忧。【原文：Tesla shares fell to their lowest in more than a year on Thursday after Deutsche Bank raised concerns over the electric automaker's increasing focus on its autonomous vehicle products when profit is under pressure.】

item.title: 美联储主席威廉姆斯认为没有必要紧急降息
item.description: 纽约联储主席约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）周四表示，美国经济的强劲状况意味着现在没有迫切需要降息。【原文：New York Federal Reserve President John Williams said on Thursday the strong state of the U.S. economy means there's no pressing case to lower interest rates right now.】

item.title: 诺斯罗普-格鲁曼公司与马斯克的 SpaceX 公司合作开发美国间谍卫星系统
item.description: 据熟悉该项目的人士透露，航空航天和国防公司诺斯罗普-格鲁曼（Northrop Grumman）正在与亿万富翁企业家埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的太空公司 SpaceX 合作，开展一个机密的间谍卫星项目，该项目已经开始捕捉高分辨率的地球图像。【原文：Aerospace and defense company Northrop Grumman is working with SpaceX, the space venture of billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk, on a classified spy satellite project already capturing high-resolution imagery of the Earth, according to people familiar with the program.】

item.title: 美联储将于 9 月降息，今年或再降息一次 - 路透社调查
item.description: 路透社对 100 位经济学家进行的调查显示，大多数经济学家认为美国联邦储备委员会将等到 9 月份才会下调其关键利率，其中一半人认为今年只会下调两次，只有约三分之一的人预测会下调更多。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve will wait until September to cut its key interest rate, according to a majority of 100 economists polled by Reuters, with half saying there will be only two cuts this year and only about a third forecasting more.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯-奔驰工人将于五月就加入 UAW 事宜进行投票
item.description: 美国全国劳资关系委员会（NLRB）周四表示，阿拉巴马州万斯奔驰工厂的工人将于 5 月 13 日至 5 月 17 日投票决定是否加入联合汽车工人工会。【原文：Workers at a Mercedes Benz factory in Vance, Alabama will vote between May 13 and May 17 on whether to join the United Auto Workers union, the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国 3 月成屋销售下降；中位数价格上涨
item.description: 由于利率和房价的上涨使购房者对市场望而却步，3 月份美国成屋销售下降。【原文：U.S. existing home sales fell in March as higher interest rates and house prices sidelined buyers from the market.】

item.title: 联合健康旗下 Change Healthcare 在处理部分医疗索赔时遇到问题
item.description: 联合健康集团（UnitedHealth Group）周四表示，其 Change Healthcare 部门提供的一项服务在接收客户的医疗索赔批次时遇到了问题。【原文：UnitedHealth Group said on Thursday a service provided by its Change Healthcare unit was facing an issue receiving batches of medical claims from customers.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数低位持平
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济的美国人数量维持在低水平，表明劳动力市场持续强劲。【原文：The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits was unchanged at low levels last week, pointing to continued labor market strength.】

item.title: 电动工具需求疲软，Snap-On 季度销售额不及预期
item.description: 由于汽车服务和维修技术人员购买公司生产的工具和设备的数量减少，抵消了汽车经销商对公司产品的稳定需求，Snap-On 公司周四的第一季度销售额未能达到华尔街的预期。【原文：Snap-On missed Wall Street estimates for first-quarter sales on Thursday, as vehicle service and repair technicians bought fewer tools and equipment made by the company, offsetting steady demand for its products from auto dealerships.】

item.title: KeyCorp 和 Comerica 与其他主要贷款机构一样，利息收入受到冲击
item.description: KeyCorp 和 Comerica 周四表示，由于借贷成本上升抑制了贷款需求，预计 2024 年的利息收入将下降，这与本财报季美国大型贷款机构所表达的担忧如出一辙。【原文：KeyCorp and Comerica are expecting a fall in interest income in 2024 as higher borrowing costs temper loan demand, they said on Thursday, echoing fears flagged by bigger U.S. lenders this earnings season.】

item.title: Blackstone 报告第一季度盈利增长 1
item.description: 全球最大的私募股权投资公司黑石集团（Blackstone Inc）周四表示，其第一季度可分配利润同比增长 1%，主要得益于费用相关收益的增长，但部分增长被资产剥离收入的下降所抵消。【原文：Blackstone Inc , the world's largest private equity firm, said on Thursday that its first-quarter distributable earnings rose 1% year-on-year supported by growth in fee-related earnings that was partly offset by a decline in income from asset divestments.】

item.title: 谷歌解雇 28 名抗议以色列云合同的员工
item.description: 谷歌周四表示，在一些员工参与抗议该公司与以色列政府签订云合同后，该公司已解雇了 28 名员工。【原文：Google said on Thursday it had terminated 28 employees after some staff participated in protests against the company's cloud contract with the Israeli government.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利称美元的主导储备货币地位将持续下去
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）在周四的一份报告中说，美元的主导储备货币地位可能会持续下去，部分原因是缺乏包括人民币在内的可信挑战者。【原文：The U.S. dollar's dominant reserve currency status is likely to endure partly because credible challengers, including the Chinese yuan, are lacking, Morgan Stanley said in a report on Thursday.】

item.title: 住房供应紧张，美国住宅建筑商 D.R. Horton 利润上升
item.description: 周四，D.R. Horton 公布季度利润增长，原因是美国紧张的住房供应促进了房屋销售。【原文：D.R. Horton posted a rise in quarterly profit on Thursday, as tight housing supply in the United States lifted home sales.】

item.title: 巴西在亚马逊钻探石油的计划遭到土著居民的强烈抵制
item.description: 国营能源公司巴西国家石油公司（Petrobras）的首要勘探项目遭到土著团体和政府机构越来越多的抵制，该项目将把巴西北部海岸最有潜力的地区开放给石油钻探。【原文：State-run energy firm Petrobras has hit growing resistance from Indigenous groups and government agencies to its premier exploration project, which would open the most promising part of Brazil's northern coast to oil drilling.】

item.title: 独家报道面对美国压力，墨西哥将停止对中国电动汽车制造商的激励措施
item.description: 三位熟悉内情的墨西哥官员表示，在美国的压力下，墨西哥联邦政府拒绝为电动汽车生产投资提供低成本公共土地或减税等激励措施，从而与中国汽车制造商保持距离。【原文：Mexico's federal government, under pressure from the U.S., is keeping Chinese automakers at arm's length by refusing to offer such incentives as low-cost public land or tax cuts for investment in EV production, three Mexican officials familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 巴拉圭大豆产量有望创历史新高，但河流水位低导致出口放缓
item.description: 巴拉圭的大豆收成将创历史新高，但出口商担心，由于巴西中西部的干旱影响了下游的水位，巴拉圭-巴拉那重要水道的河水水位过低，导致运输放缓。【原文：Paraguay is headed for a record soybean harvest but exporters are worried about low river levels that are slowing shipments along the key Paraguay-Paraná waterway, with a drought in central-west Brazil affecting water levels running downstream.】

item.title: 聚焦：巴拿马大选不太可能改变第一量子铜矿的前景
item.description: 路透社对竞选提案的审查和对抗议领袖的采访显示，第一量子矿业公司（First Quantum Minerals）在 5 月总统大选后收回被取消的利润丰厚的铜矿特许权的前景并不乐观。【原文：Prospects are poor for First Quantum Minerals to recover its canceled concession for a lucrative copper mine after presidential elections in May, a Reuters review of the campaigns' proposals and interviews with protest leaders show.】
